Hi, Kent!
Your example with Chart API is good. However, your example with
p=
ayment processing is completely nightmare for me. I didn't understand
what =
does the application, what client thought and what what problem
you strike =
with. I also didn't understand your Stability and
Reliability aspect. I gue=
ss this is because I didn't understand your
payment processing example. 

-=
-- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "kentb" <kentb@...> wrote:
>
> All,
> 
> Last =
week on succeeding days I encountered two situations, one where
> system-le=
vel tests were valuable and unit tests would have been
useless and
> one wh=
ere the reverse was true. Since simply the level of the tests
is not
> suff=
icient to decide where to test, I thought a bit more about how I
should
> d=
ecide where to test. I came to three criteria:
>   * The cost of writing an=
d running the test
>   * The stability of the interface the test is, errr..=
., testing
>   * The reliability of the code satisfying the test
> 
> I wro=
te this up in a little paper:
> www.threeriversinstitute.org/WhereToTest.ht=
ml. Comments welcome.
